definitions.definition: to buy insurance so that you will receive money if your property, car, etc. gets damaged or stolen, or if you get ill or die
definitions.sensetop: insure something/yourself (for something)insure something/yourself (against something)insure against something

examples.text: The painting is insured for $1 million.
You should insure the car against fire and theft.
Luckily he had insured himself against long-term illness.
Having a lot of children is a way of insuring themselves against loneliness in old age.
We strongly recommend insuring against sickness or injury.

definitions.definition: to sell insurance to somebody for something

examples.text: The company can refuse to insure a property that does not have window locks.

definitions.definition: to make sure that something happens or is definite
definitions.labels: (especially North American English)British and North American English

wordOrigin: late Middle English (in the sense ‘assure someone of something’): alteration of ensure.
